section.title: Binance\API::__construct ()
section.emphasis: Constructor for the class, send as many agument as you want.

section.title: Binance\API::buy (string $symbol, $quantity, $price, string $type="LIMIT", array $flags=[])
section.emphasis: buy attempts to create a currency order each currency supports a number of order types, such as -LIMIT -MARKET -STOP_LOSS -STOP_LOSS_LIMIT -TAKE_PROFIT -TAKE_PROFIT_LIMIT -LIMIT_MAKER

entry.para: string price per unit you want to spend
array addtional options for order type

formalpara.title: Returns:
formalpara.para: array with error message or the order details

section.title: Binance\API::buyTest (string $symbol, $quantity, $price, string $type="LIMIT", array $flags=[])
section.emphasis: buyTest attempts to create a TEST currency order

entry.para: string price per unit you want to spend

formalpara.title: Returns:
formalpara.para: array with error message or empty or the order details

section.title: Binance\API::order (string $side, string $symbol, $quantity, $price, string $type="LIMIT", array $flags=[], bool $test=false)
section.emphasis: order formats the orders before sending them to the curl wrapper function You can call this function directly or use the helper functions
section.para:
See Also:
buy()
sell()
marketBuy()
marketSell() $this->httpRequest( "https://api.binance.com/api/v1/ticker/24hr");
Parameters
$side
string typically "BUY" or "SELL"
$symbol
string to buy or sell
$quantity
string in the order
$price
string for the order
$type
string is determined by the symbol bu typicall LIMIT, STOP_LOSS_LIMIT etc.
$flags
array additional transaction options
$test
bool whether to test or not, test only validates the query
Returns:
array containing the response
exception
\Exception

section.title: Binance\API::candlesticks (string $symbol, string $interval="5m", int $limit=null, $startTime=null, $endTime=null)
section.emphasis: candlesticks get the candles for the given intervals 1m,3m,5m,15m,30m,1h,2h,4h,6h,8h,12h,1d,3d,1w,1M
section.para:
Parameters
$symbol
string to query
$interval
string to request
$limit
int limit the amount of candles
$startTime
string request candle information starting from here
$endTime
string request candle information ending here
Returns:
array containing the response
exception
\Exception

section.title: Binance\API::sortDepth (string $symbol, int $limit=11)
section.emphasis: sortDepth Sorts depth data for display & getting highest bid and lowest ask

section.title: Binance\API::depthCache ($symbols, Callable $callback)
section.emphasis: depthCache Pulls /depth data and subscribes to @depth WebSocket endpoint Maintains a local Depth Cache in sync via lastUpdateId.
section.para: $api->depthCache(["BNBBTC"], function($api, $symbol, $depth) { echo "{$symbol} depth cache update".PHP_EOL; //print_r($depth); // Print all depth data $limit = 11; // Show only the closest asks/bids $sorted = $api->sortDepth($symbol, $limit); $bid = $api->first($sorted['bids']); $ask = $api->first($sorted['asks']); echo $api->displayDepth($sorted); echo "ask: {$ask}".PHP_EOL; echo "bid: {$bid}".PHP_EOL; });

section.title: Binance\API::userData (&$balance_callback, &$execution_callback=false)
section.emphasis: userData Issues userDataStream token and keepalive, subscribes to userData WebSocket
section.para: $order_update = function($api, $report) { echo "Order update".PHP_EOL; print_r($report); $price = $report['price']; $quantity = $report['quantity']; $symbol = $report['symbol']; $side = $report['side']; $orderType = $report['orderType']; $orderId = $report['orderId']; $orderStatus = $report['orderStatus']; $executionType = $report['orderStatus']; if( $executionType == "NEW" ) { if( $executionType == "REJECTED" ) { echo "Order Failed! Reason: {$report['rejectReason']}".PHP_EOL; } echo "{$symbol} {$side} {$orderType} ORDER #{$orderId} ({$orderStatus})".PHP_EOL; echo "..price: {$price}, quantity: {$quantity}".PHP_EOL; return; }
//NEW, CANCELED, REPLACED, REJECTED, TRADE, EXPIRED echo "{$symbol} {$side} {$executionType} {$orderType} ORDER #{$orderId}".PHP_EOL; }; $api->userData($balance_update, $order_update);

Parameters
$balance_callback
callable function
$execution_callback
callable function
Returns:
null
exception
\Exception

section.title: Binance\API::setupApiConfigFromFile (string $file=null)
section.emphasis: If no paramaters are supplied in the constructor, this function will attempt to load the api_key and api_secret from the users home directory in the file ~/jaggedsoft/php-binance-api.json.

section.title: Binance\API::setupProxyConfigFromFile (string $file=null)
section.emphasis: If no paramaters are supplied in the constructor for the proxy confguration, this function will attempt to load the proxy info from the users home directory ~/jaggedsoft/php-binance-api.json.

section.title: Binance\API::httpRequest (string $url, string $method="GET", array $params=[], bool $signed=false)
section.emphasis: httpRequest curl wrapper for all http api requests.
section.para: You can't call this function directly, use the helper functions

See Also:
buy()
sell()
marketBuy()
marketSell() $this->httpRequest( "https://api.binance.com/api/v1/ticker/24hr");
Parameters
$url
string the endpoint to query, typically includes query string
$method
string this should be typically GET, POST or DELETE
$params
array addtional options for the request
$signed
bool true or false sign the request with api secret
Returns:
array containing the response
exception
\Exception

section.title: Binance\API::balanceData (array $array, $priceData)
section.emphasis: balanceData Converts all your balances into a nice array If priceData is passed from $api->prices() it will add btcValue & btcTotal to each symbol This function sets $btc_value which is your estimated BTC value of all assets combined and $btc_total which includes amount on order
